curriculum vitae

General Information

Full Name Shrutheesh Raman Iyer
Contact siyer [at] ucsd [dot] edu
Languages English (fluent), Tamil (native), Kannada (intermediate)

Research Areas

  • My primary research area of interest is robotics.
  • I am interested in tackling problems ranging from robot manipulation to autonomous navigation and SLAM.
  • I'm also interested in exploring multi-agent coordination and UAVs.

Education

  • 2021 - 2023 (E)
    University of California, San Diego – M.S. in Computer Science and Engineering
    • Specialization in Robotics
    • GPA: 4.0 (4.0 scale)
  • 2016 - 2020
    RV College of Engineering – B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
    • GPA: 9.6 (10.0 scale)

Research Projects and Experience

  • 2021 - now
    Generalized Framework for Robot Tool Improvisation
    Graduate Student at CogRob CRI, UCSD
    • Advised by Prof. Henrik Christensen
    • Working on developing a generalized framework for robot tool use through object affordances
    • Implementing an end-to-end system in CoppeliaSim Simulator and on a physical Fetch Robot
  • 2019 - 2021
    Monocular Visual Odometry
    Research Intern and Technical associate at the Robert Bosch Center for Cyber Physical Systems, IISc
    • Advised by Prof. Raghu Krishnapuram
    • Compared deep learning based feature extractors with traditional ones for navigation tasks
    • Published a comprehensive survey on advancements in monocular visual odometry over the years.
  • 2020 - 2021
    Teleoperation of a Humanoid Robot
    Technical associate at the Robert Bosch Center for Cyber Physical Systems, IISc
    • Advised by Prof. Raghu Krishnapuram and Prof. Bharadwaj Amrutur
    • Research project to develop a teleoperated humanoiod robotic nurse as part of ANA Xprize Avatar challenge which aims to deploy real-time senses in remote environments. https://aham-avatar.org/)
    • Worked on tracking human arm movements on the robot using optical trackers and VR technology. Developed an in-house data glove with finger tracking and haptic feedback for hand teleoperation
    • Contributed to the entire teleoperation architecture including networking and inverse kinematics control
  • 2020 - 2021
    Analysis of Financial Filings
    Research assistant at the Finance and Accounting Department, Indian Institute of Management (IIMB)
    • Advised by Prof. Srinivasan Rangan, and PhD Student, Prabhu Venkatachalam
    • Implemented a pipeline to extract textual and numeric data from public financial filings of firms for an academic project which seeks to develop a new measure of Disclosure Quality
    • Developed all stages of the data science pipeline from web scraping to cleaning to analysis and visualization
    • Developed textual analysis methods at low level using regular expressions and contextual level using regex and scipy

Other Experience

  • Summer 2018
    &
    Summer 2019
    Internship at LightMetrics Pvt. Ltd.
    • Worked in the video telematics team over two consecutive summers.
    • Compared the performance of various techniques for compressing neural networks for real-time performance on edge compute. Implemented filter based and activation based pruning techniques to achieve reduction in size and speedup for object detection.
    • Also involved in analysis of large volumes of driver related incidents for the fleet, to automate identifying trends and producing weekly reports
  • 2017 - 2020
    Team Lead at Project Jatayu
    • Project Jatayu is the flagship autonomous unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) team of undergraduate university, RVCE
    • Team member from Aug 2017. Computer vision Subsystem Lead and Team Lead from 2019 to 2020
    • Enabled perception in noisy and poorly-lit environments by developing image and video processing protocols for drone footage, and compared ANNs for object recognition and localization
    • Led the team in the AUVSI Student Unmanned Aerial Systems Competition 2019 (SUAS 2019), Maryland, USA
  • 2019
    Consulting Part-time Software Engineer at Citrix Systems
    • Project in collaboration with RVCE and Citrix Systems
    • Developed a Conversational bot for the SDWAN Networks used by the organization to accept routing queries in natural language
    • Developed a robust CLI as an intermediary, and used Google Dialogflow to provide natural language queries

Skills

  • ○ Programming languages: Python, C++, C, Matlab, R
  • ○ Robotics Development: ROS with C/C++ and Python. Familiar with move_it and inverse kinematics
  • ○ Simulation Environments: Coppelia, Gazebo and Bullet
  • ○ Computer Vision: Comfortable with Camera Calibration, multi view geometry and SLAM. Familiar with FFMPEG for low-level tasks
  • ○ Frameworks: PyTorch, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas
  • ○ Database Systems: MySQL, Neo4j, Gremlin, XML

Teaching Experience

  • Winter 2022
    Teaching Assistant for Intoduction to Statistics
    • Undergraduate level introduction to statistics for students from the psychology major, taught by Prof. Eric Steiner
    • I mentored students with their course content, assignments and quizzes
  • Fall 2021
    Teaching Assistant for Beyond Relational Models
    • Introduction to non-relational database systems for professional masters, taught by Prof. Alin Deutsch
    • Assisted the students with the course content, and graded homeworks
    • Course materials can be found here

Leadership Roles and Associated Societies

  • 2021 - now
    RV QuizCorp, RVCE
    Co-ordinator
    • Organized and participated in inter and intra-college quizzes with 100 participants
    • Host and organizer of Under the Peepal Tree (UTPT), one of Asias largest quiz festivals, in 2018, 2019 and 2020
  • 2017-2020
    Project Jatayu, RVCE
    Team Lead and Computer Vision Subsystem
    • Successfully planned and constructed custom unmanned aerial vehicles for autonomous tasks
    • Successfully led a team of over 30 members at the AUVSI Student Unmanned Aerial Systems Competition 2019(SUAS 2019), held in Maryland, USA where we secured 27th rank among 75 participating teams
  • 2015-2016
    Science Club, CMR NPS
    President
    • President of the Science club at my high school
    • Demonstrated various scientific experiments to high school students

Other Interests
